intro: Dimerandra tenuicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed dimerandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and the plant is known for its ornamental value. Dimerandra tenuicaulis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
